summary: This document is an email chain from November 10, 2020, forwarding a letter from the Marsh Law Firm concerning a potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The email discusses routing the letter to the appropriate office within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) for handling, as it pertains to a charged case.

persons.name: Robin
persons.context: A recipient of the forwarded email chain, tasked with determining if the attached letter concerns a victim of the charged Epstein/Maxwell case and processing it accordingly.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: An employee at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) who initially received the letter from the law firm.

persons.name: Jennifer Freeman
persons.context: An attorney at the Marsh Law Firm PLLC who sent the original letter concerning a potential Epstein/Maxwell victim to Audrey Strauss.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against a potential victim mentioned in the forwarded letter.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an alleged perpetrator of abuse against a potential victim mentioned in the forwarded letter.

connections.description: Both are named together as alleged perpetrators in the context of a potential victim's case mentioned in the forwarded letter.
Freeman, an attorney, sent a letter to Strauss at the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding a potential victim.
The letter received by Strauss was forwarded internally to Robin for review and processing.

events.title: Forwarding of Victim Letter
events.description: An email chain forwards a letter from the Marsh Law Firm to the U.S. Attorney's Office concerning a potential victim of Epstein and Maxwell.

keyFacts: A letter from the Marsh Law Firm, sent by attorney Jennifer Freeman, was forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York concerning a potential statutory victim of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The email discusses procedural routing, noting that if the individual is not a victim of the charged case, the office will process the letter differently.
The document highlights ongoing legal and victim identification processes related to the Epstein/Maxwell case in late 2020.
The correspondence is marked as confidential and subject to attorney-client privilege protections.
